Text.Value: If I'd known you were hunting a person, I'd have charged for my services.
What you thought was best...? This was important to me - this was everything to me.
Impressive work, Balthazar, but you are not needed anymore. The Nightsong is our sacrifice.
Dead man? You haven't been paying attention, have you? Perhaps I'll revive your carcass, and add you to my retinue. Then you'll have all the time in the world to think on your mistakes.
Perhaps it wouldn't have come to that. But we'll never know now - you took the decision away from me.
So eager to die. Very well, brute - you will make a welcome addition to my undying retinue.
The arrogance of divinity. Your patron will not hear your prayers when I add you to my undying retinue, godling.
The Nightsong is angel-born. It deserves freedom.
What would a godling know of freedom? Come - I will show you freedom. From want. From need. From everything.
You may have his trust, but you've lost mine. Farewell.
Stop him. Nightsong must not leave. She must die by my spear, or you will have failed me.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This line from Shar only plays if Shadowheart is the avatar
EditorData.VFXTags: ethereal glow around her - like the goddess is behind shadowheart

Text.Value: Aylin is so much more than that. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.
Death only frightens those of limited vision. You should be terrified, godling.
*Your blood chills as you await Lady Shar's wrath for your failure... but there is nothing. The silence is terrifying.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Shadowheart glances upwards, looking fearful.

Text.Value: Now don't struggle, Aylin. Well... maybe struggle a little.
ROAR AT THE NECROMANCER.
I agree - no more questions. More blood. YOURS.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Cinematic - B and NS leave for MT. Shadowheart not present)

Text.Value: Person? Please, you insult her - you insult me.
My companion has her own plans for this one. Stand down.
Wait - the Nightsong is a person?
You are the one who interferes - in Lady Shar's bidding. For that, you must die.
I care not for the holy creature - but you tricked me, necromancer. For that: you die.
Finding a cure is what matters - now we have Ketheric Thorm's trust.
General. Thorm. You will show respect, Aylin. Watch, and see what happens if you do not. See what I do to our acquaintance here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Chastising Nightsong. Grows menacing towards the end as it becomes clear he's referring to us while addressing Nightsong.

Text.Value: The Moonmaiden's light dances around this one... You will harm her no more, necromancer.
You will torture this angel-born no longer, necromancer.
I stand with you, Shadowheart. Slay the Nightsong, and take your place as a Dark Justiciar.
You. Your usefulness does not forgive your treachery. I felt it the very first moment I entered your mind. You are an enemy of the Absolute, banished from Moonrise.
Until then.
I invite you: heap more sins upon your head. My retribution will be all the sweeter for them.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring Balthazar dead in the eyes.

Text.Value: I make the decisions - not you.
*Do as Shar wishes, and you will become Her chosen, but the Absolute cult will know you are its enemy.*
Go on, then. Take the Nightsong to Ketheric. Get it over with.
Plans. The drone plans to court the queen bee - yet it dies all the same. Aylin is mine - an aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.

EditorData.NodeContext: Unimpressed. Mocking drawl on the first 'plans' Ah-see-mar

Text.Value: Or perhaps to lead this would-be Justiciar's blade directly to my heart?

EditorData.AnimationTags: NS: Turns defiantly towards the Speaker, enter standard staging.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: On "this Justiciar"," abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves forward out of position, magical hands grab around her wrists arms and shoulers, holding her back. She looks down at them and grimaces in rage, then steps back into place. This is how she's bound: If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by the magi-hands.
EditorData.SFXTags: Magical hands appears to hold Nightsong in place.The hands disappears as soon as she is back at her allowed space
EditorData.VFXTags: Magical hands appears to hold Nightsong in place.The hands disappears as soon as she is back at her allowed space

Text.Value: Then this is where we part ways. Shar forgive me, I was so close... Farewell.
Her power, his will, and my genius. An unsurpassable feat.
You cannot bind a person to the needs of another. Free her. Now.
She is a person - not a thing to be used. On my oath, she will be freed.
I'm sorry. But I have my reasons. I did what I thought was best.
Hold your tongue, Aylin. Or I'll take it away from you again. And you - no more questions. No more interference.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: First sentence addressed to Nightsong. Glances at player for second sentence.
EditorData.NodeContext: First line to Nightsong, second to player.

Text.Value: Bring her home - what else? Aylin is so much more than you comprehend. She is an aasimar, bound to a soulcage of my creation, and lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.
There's nothing more to be said. Farewell.
Fly at me, you fool. You cannot stop what is to come.
I can't let you take her, Balthazar.
Ketheric. I welcome the sight of him, after these hundred years. He whose immortality I supply with my very soul.

EditorData.NodeContext: She spits on the floor of her cage after 'Ketheric'

Text.Value: The Nightsong's a person? Balthazar, this is an affront to the Weave itself.
Keep back. It will take quite some concentration to secure Aylin for her little journey.
All this time, and you still fail to appreciate the gifts I bestowed on you, Aylin. Sad, to see a thing of beauty not recognise its own worth.
Perhaps there will be something I can salvage from your carcass once I'm finished; I hate to see flesh squandered - even a traitor's flesh.
What are you going to do to her?
What have you done?! Her fate was mine to decide!

EditorData.NodeContext: Shock and outrage. Her moment of religious fulfilment has been denied.

Text.Value: I can do whatever I want! She is mine. An aasimar bound to a soulcage of my creation. Lending her immortal strength to General Thorm.
But General Thorm - he appreciates you. And he wants you close at hand, so I am here to whisk you back to him.

EditorData.AnimationTags: BAL: Performs a transport ritual on himself and NS, NS: Still defiant, seething beneath the surface but accepting of whatever comes next.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar performs the ritual that transports him and Nightsong to Moonrise
EditorData.SFXTags: Balthazar performs a ritual that transports him and Nightsong away.
EditorData.VFXTags: Balthazar performs a ritual that transports him and Nightsong away
EditorData.logicalname: Cinematic - B and NS leave for MT (Shadowheart Present)

Text.Value: Get it over with? No, this is to be savoured. Return to Moonrise Towers - I'm sure we'll find further use for you there.
I couldn't let you kill her.
Attack him.
General. Thorm. I'm sure you'll be on your best behaviour for him. But just in case, I've taken some precautions.
The Nightsong is Shar's sacrifice - she's my destiny. He cannot have her!

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent. Her sacred mission is in jeopardy

Text.Value: If she's the reason Ketheric Thorm is invulnerable, you're not taking her. Leave, or you're a dead man.
A pleasure to have made your acquaintance, little warrior. We will meet again. I am eternal; I will be free, one day; and I never forget a face.
Balthazar. Come to add more bars to my cage.

EditorData.AnimationTags: NS: Pacing back and forth in a LOOP
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

Text.Value: Ramblings most unsane. Poor Balthazar, for maggots ate his brain long ago.

EditorData.NodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

Text.Value: If this Nightsong is the source of Ketheric's power, we cannot let Balthazar take her. We should unleash her wrath.

Synopsis: If Balthazar is alive when the player reaches Nightsong, they will encounter a dialogue where Balthazar and Nightsong square off. The player has one last chance to betray Balthazar and prevent him from taking Nightsong to Moonrise.
